intro: Meconopsis argemonantha var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow meconopsis, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and sturdy. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, long-lasting blooms.
